comment: Nothing special
Sorry, wasn't able to take it easy.
Digital version of this was entertaining enough, but physical version is too tedious for not enough of a return.

Too abstract and mathy for us. Also I really disliked the fact, that players could just copy other players' actions. The rules only stated: "you shouldn't do that, because they might not be better than you.". Aha.
此桌遊非常看重運氣，雖說是使用相同的牌，但會因為玩家的擺放位置，而影響最終結果；同時，翻牌員最終是否會翻到你所想要的數字牌，也是個重要的關鍵。
a combination of obvious plays, luck, and (rarely) a slight illusion of choice.

I loved playing this as a kid. Nostalgia sometimes gets me to play it again but without tinted glasses i just have to admit: Its quite ugly, mathy and repetitive.

Quick and easier filler. Not bad. Many can play.

I'd play if again but not sure I'd buy it.

I own multiple sets of Take it Easy! We've had 30+ people play simultaneously. At Gulf Games when I attended, over 100 people played in the same game.

The game itself is sort of advanced bingo. A nice game that is enhanced by the large group potential.

Keep
Not for trade. Solo play option. 20 mins play. Very light game. Abstract game but I love this one. Works well with younger players too.
需要策略才能獲得高分的數學遊戲,可以訓練學生的加法與乘法

Didn't played it for a long time. Pulled it from the shelf after 3 years and still had fun. Yes, it sometimes depends on luck to get the right tile on the right time, but the tension when the next tile is flipped over makes it a great game for me.
